column4: Where should I put the Sun JDK directory? Surely not /usr/jdk1.5.0_08/, right?
either symlink java to somewhere in your path, or add the dir to your path

figures. But it's the first distro that doesn't screw up my mouse. I don't know what driver it uses, but even after checking ALL available drivers on, e.g., Debian the mouse would still act quirky (random jumping etc).
did you change the battery in it before you installed ubuntu?
Nope. No battery. It's a cable one.
weird, is it running through a kvm or something?
that sucks, i have a bunch of usb mice for just that reason...this old kvm doesn't like mine either
However, Ubuntu recognised it instantly. With the other distros even trying all drivers manually didn't work.
ironically though i had more issues in windows than linux
Ubuntu feels a bit too user-friendly sometimes (this is after about a week of using it). I mean that in the same sense I mean it for WinXP.
Also I've come to realise I loathe KDE. GNOME is so much prettier.
